Issues.Title: build: depend on bazelisk rather than directly on Bazel
Issues.Body:
Based off of @alexeagle's PR https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/35153

This has a couple benefits:
- we now use a .bazelversion file rather than package.json to pin the version of bazel we want. This means even if you install bazel on your computer rather than via yarn, you'll still get a warning if your bazel version is wrong.
- you no longer end up downloading three copies of bazel due to bugs in both npm and yarn where they download all tarballs before checking the metadata to see which are usable on the local platform.
- bazelisk correctly handles the tools/bazel trick for wrapping functionality, which we want to use to instrument developer build latencies

Issues.Title: Cache ngcc compiled node modules
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
angular/compiler

### Description
Don't recompile the ngcc compilations modules when they do not change.

**For example:**

package.json
```
  "dependencies": {
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "0.900.5",
    "@angular/cli": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/common": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/compiler": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/core": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "9.0.5",
    "bootstrap": "4.4.0"
  },
```

- Run `yarn install` on the package.json above
- Run `ngcc --properties es2015 browser module main`
- Update bootstap to "4.4.1"

```
  "dependencies": {
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "0.900.5",
    "@angular/cli": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/common": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/compiler": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/core": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "9.0.5",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "9.0.5",
    "bootstrap": "4.4.1"
  },
```

- Run `yarn install`
- Run `ngcc --properties es2015 browser module main`

When running the ngcc command again all of the already compiled node modules get recompiled. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
Provide an option within ngcc to only compile the packages that changed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cache ngcc compiled node modules" (#36076)

Issues.Title: fix(core): prevent unknown property check for AOT-compiled components
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, the unknown property check was unnecessarily invoked for AOT-compiled components (for these components, the check happens at compile time). This commit updates the code to avoid unknown property verification for AOT-compiled components by checking whether schemas information is present (as a way to detect whether this is JIT or AOT compiled component).

Note: there is a similar check performed for unknown elements check as well (added in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/34024).

Resolves #35945.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): prevent unknown property check for AOT-compiled components" (#36072)

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): include correct dependencies in StackBlitz examples
Issues.Body:
Previously, all StackBlitz examples included the default dependencies for `cli`-type projects. However, different example types may have different `package.json` files with different dependencies.
For example, the [boilerplate `package.json`][1] for `elements` examples includes an extra dependency on `@angular/elements`.

This commit changes `StackblitzBuilder` to use the dependencies that correspond to each example type.
(NOTE: Manually verified the changes.)

Jira issue: [FW-2002][2]

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/05d058622/aio/tools/examples/shared/boilerplate/elements/package.json
[2]: https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-2002

[FW-2002]: https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-2002
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(docs-infra): include correct dependencies in StackBlitz examples" (#36071)

Issues.Title: App Not Loading Intermittently In Firefox - Polyfills.js
Issues.Body:
**Description:**

I have a angular app written in version 7.1.0 and this app intermittently does not loads in Firefox however works perfectly in chrome.

Issue which I can see in developer's tool looks to be in Polyfills.js however when I dig it a bit deeper is found in Zone.js -> function resolvePromise(promise, state, value)

Why I am saying this is intermittent is because after I encounter this issue then reloading the application using Ctrl+F5 sometimes fixes the issues and sometimes does not.

I could not found much on internet related to similar kind of issues faced by other developers however there were few issues reported by other developers in Pollyfills.js which were due to incorrect version's of dependent modules but that were not of much help to me since I am a new to Angular and could not relate to the issues well.

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> The issue is caused by package @angular/service-worker


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> No


### Description

In our application we use a http redirect to the login page if for an example session times out.
This works perfectly fine without the service worker enabled, however with the service worker this fails.

To my observation, the `mode` of the `Request` is changed from `navigate` to `cors`.

Without SW:
```
Sec-Fetch-Dest: document
Sec-Fetch-Mode: navigate
```

With SW:
```
Sec-Fetch-Dest: empty
Sec-Fetch-Mode: cors
```

Would it be a good solution simply ignore the requests with `redirect` mode?

## üî• Exception or Error

```html
Access to fetch at 'https://authentication-url.com/...' (redirected from 'https://my-w
ebsite.com/file-request.json') from origin 'https://my-website.com' has been blocked by
CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 
'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque
response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource
with CORS disabled.
```

Issues.Title: Angular Widgets
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request
Angular widgets that are going to work as **components** would be great!

### Description
Coming from android and other UI frameworks, widgets like date and clock pickers can
really optimize and speed up your development. It would be really awesome to have
built-in angular components for frequently input strategies, for example, @angular/widgets.

Of course, this is not an important requirement for the angular framework, but I believe it could
speed up the development especially for new web developers.

Unfortunately, I lack the knowledge of making them, especially when it comes to 
good designs with CSS.

Using `<input type="date">` is quite boring for users. Of course, you can find open source
CSS styles, but working with angular components directly would be a lot better experience!

Thank you for your time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Widgets" (#36065)

Issues.Title: :host-context() Improperly Emulated in Pre-Built Library
Issues.Body:
When a component in a library that is pre-built separately from the rest of the application, using: `ng build lib-sample`, the styles for the `:host-context` selector are not correctly emulated.

When it's not pre-built and complied along with the rest of the Angular application, the emulation works correctly.

Please see this example: [https://github.com/brianmtreese/angular-lib-build-host-context](https://github.com/brianmtreese/angular-lib-build-host-context)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ":host-context() Improperly Emulated in Pre-Built Library" (#36063)

Issues.Title: Angular9 - Need to run ngcc for library to function with ivy enabled
Issues.Body:
Good day!

I'm the author of the [OverlayScrollbars](https://github.com/KingSora/OverlayScrollbars) library and I'm providing a Angular wrapper. This wrapper is written in TypeScript but isn't using ng-packagr for building. Instead I've written my own build script, and I'm compiling it with `ngc` the repo can be found [here](https://github.com/KingSora/OverlayScrollbars/tree/master/packages/overlayscrollbars-ngx). 
The wrapper isn't very complex and also isn't using any special, exotic or deprecated features of Angular.

Since Angular9 user have reported issues ([here](https://github.com/KingSora/OverlayScrollbars/issues/190) and [here](https://github.com/KingSora/OverlayScrollbars/issues/141)) with the wrapper, which are related to ivy. After a bit of experimenting I found out, that you have to run `npx ngcc` to make it function (at least its working in my project).

My question is, how do I prevent this? I know that Angular is running the `ngcc` command if you compile your project with `ng serve` but for some reason this isn't enough for my library. I have to run it manually in order to not getting a error in the browser console.

I checked the `package.json` before and after running `ngcc` manually and the difference is small, but there is a difference in the `__processed_by_ivy_ngcc__` section:
**Before running ngcc manually:**
```json
"__processed_by_ivy_ngcc__": {
  "module": "9.0.6",
  "typings": "9.0.6"
}
```
**After running ngcc manually:**
```json
"__processed_by_ivy_ngcc__": {
  "main": "9.0.6",
  "module": "9.0.6",
  "typings": "9.0.6"
}
```
How can I tell angular to run ngcc also on the main module without executing `ngcc` manually, or how can I solve the whole issue differently?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular9 - Need to run ngcc for library to function with ivy enabled" (#36062)

Issues.Title: BrowserAnimationsModule breaks size calculations
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/platform-browser/animations ### Is this a regression? The latest version working was 5.2.3 ### Description When Angular router is used to navigate and a new component is loaded into router-outlet, the size retrieved from the new compoent in OnInit or AfterViewInit is wrong whenever BrowserAnimationsModule is used. In the StackBlitz example the FrameComponent gets loaded into router-outlet. In OnInit and AfterViewInit the size of the div #frame gets read by `this.frame.nativeElement.client[Width/Height]` When BrowserAnimationsModule is part of AppModule, the height of the div is completely wrong (should be the same as viewport height). If BrowserAnimationsModule does not get imported, the size of the div gets reported correctly. This breaks any application that depends on size calculations. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rac6sy * Load StackBlitz and open up the console (the sizes get logged there) * Click on the link "Click Here" * Check the logged size in the console (especially the height) * Go to app.module and delete BrowserAnimationsModule from imports * Reload and repeat the above process -> the size is now correct (viewport size) ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
NG 9.0.6
Chrome 80.0.3987.132
Firefox 74
Windows 10 1909
**Anything else relevant?** May be related to #20290 but I am not sure if it is the exact same problem
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BrowserAnimationsModule breaks size calculations" (#36054)

Issues.Title: fix(common): properly get root nodes from embedded views with <ng-content>
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes 2 separate issues related to root nodes retrieval from
embedded views with `<ng-content>`:

1) we did not account for the case where there were no projectable nodes
for a given `<ng-content>`;

2) we did not account for the case where projectable nodes for a given
`<ng-content>` were represented as an array of native nodes (happens in
the case of dynamically created components with projectable nodes);

Fixes #35967

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [ ] new

### Is this a regression?

The bug was introduced by this commit:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/770de947c88a0fcac8c0948df655fe8ec2b37d0b#diff-86d5f24a73f7db8e65c3e66c4dab5205

### Description

Our project does not have budgets set for all configurations. After upgrading to Angular 9, it cannot be built because of the following exception during the build process.

Calls to `Array.reduce` functions are missing default values here https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/9.0.x/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.ts


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

We do not any simple reproducer, however the bug is obvious from the code directly.

## üî• Exception or Error

```
[error] TypeError: Reduce of empty array with no initial value
    at Array.reduce (<anonymous>)
    at Object.values.map (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.js:151:18)
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at BundleCalculator.calculate (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.js:147:65)
    at calculateSizes (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.js:101:23)
    at Object.checkBudgets (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/utilities/bundle-calculator.js:271:23)
    at checkBudgets.next (<anonymous>)
    at BundleBudgetPlugin.runChecks (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/plugins/bundle-budget.js:22:40)
    at compiler.hooks.afterEmit.tap (/project/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/plugins/bundle-budget.js:14:18)
    at _next0 (eval at create (/project/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:19:1)
    at _err0 (eval at create (/project/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:44:1)
    at compiler.hooks.afterEmit.tapAsync (/project/node_modules/copy-webpack-plugin/dist/index.js:115:7)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.eval [as callAsync] (eval at create (/project/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:40:1)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.lazyCompileHook (/project/node_modules/tapable/lib/Hook.js:154:20)
    at asyncLib.forEachLimit.err (/project/node_modules/webpack/lib/Compiler.js:482:27)
    at /project/node_modules/neo-async/async.js:2818:7


```


## üåç Your Environment

Even after adding the default budgets config, it still fails.

```
"budgets": [
                {
                  "type": "anyComponentStyle",
                  "maximumWarning": "6kb"
                }
              ]

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bundle calculator assumes bundle size configs otherwise reduce fails on empty array" (#17215)

Issues.Title: Spy on jasmine function from an Angular library is not working
Issues.Body:
I have an Angular library containing functions like "export function myFunction".  
The project with the error have this library as a dependency and when I want to spy on the function, the error below is display:

```typescript
myFunction is not declared writable or has no setter
```

**Now the real world example**:

*A simple function from the library:*
```typescript
export function isNotEmptyString(value: any): value is string {
  return _.isString(value) && !_.isEmpty(value);
}
```

*The dts of this function once packaged:*
```typescript
export declare function isNotEmptyString(value: any): value is string;
```

To spy on the function, I must have an object at some point.  
So I use a custom module import to achieve this.

*The spy on error:*
```typescript
import * as MyLibfrom 'my-lib';

const isNotEmptyStringSpy = spyOn(MyLib, 'isNotEmptyString').and.returnValue(false);
```

*And the error is:*
```typescript
isNotEmptyString is not declared writable or has no setter
```

*Now, if I use a `spyOnPropety`:*
```typescript
import * as MyLibfrom 'my-lib';

const isNotEmptyStringSpy = spyOnProperty(MyLib, 'isNotEmptyString').and.returnValue(() => false);
```

*And the new error is:*
```typescript
isNotEmptyString is not declared configurable
```

I also tried to use differents module inside the `tsconfig.json` compiler options.  
Like `commonjs`, `CommonJS`, `ES2015` and `ESNext`.  
There is no difference.

*tsconfig.json*
```typescript
"compilerOptions": {
  "module": "commonjs"
}
```

Does anyone have a suggestion?  
I am stuck with this :/  

Thanks !

*Environment:*
```
"karma": "4.4.1"
"jasmine-core": "3.5.0"
"@angular/core": "9.0.5"
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Spy on jasmine function from an Angular library is not working" (#17207)

Issues.Title: The Array.includes polyfill is not added to the polyfills-es5.ts file
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

This is duplicate of https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/14815

The fix isn't provided by cli yet.

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
The previous versions don't have the Differential Loading concept

### Description

When updating from 7 to 8:
The angular schematic that does the migration drops all polyfills of array functions

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/9c4da54b63ed2fe526355c937952aaba3b888497/packages/schematics/angular/migrations/update-8/drop-es6-polyfills.ts#L33

but the angular 8 cli polyfills doesn't include the polyfill
`import 'core-js/modules/es.array.includes';`

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/9c4da54b63ed2fe526355c937952aaba3b888497/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/es5-polyfills.js#L37

the workaround is manually adding the missing polyfill to polyfills.ts.

looking for a fix from angular team.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The Array.includes polyfill is not added to the polyfills-es5.ts file" (#17217)

Issues.Title: Schematics: Unit testing a rule that uses mergeWith/apply fails due to missing context
Issues.Body:
## Addendum

In creating the test case I've realised that I'm not passing a `partialContext` to `callRule`, so it is definitely missing context, however, it is not at all clear _what_ context is necessary for `mergeWith` to succeed and the error does not indicate that context is actually missing.

Happy for this to be marked as a question instead. Guidance on _how_ to provide the context and _what_ context to provide would be amazingly useful.

# üêû Bug report

### Description

Using `callRule` to unit test rules within a schematic fails when it comes to rules which return `mergeWith`

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

See: https://github.com/jdpearce/schematics-apply-problem

Given a rule which applies template files to the tree, this unit test will fail with `TypeError: Cannot read property 'path' of undefined`:

```ts
describe('applyTemplateFiles Rule', () => {
  let tree: UnitTestTree;

  beforeEach(async () => {
    tree = new UnitTestTree(Tree.empty());
  });

  it('should apply the files to the tree', async () => {
    const schema = {};

    tree = (await callRule(applyTemplateFiles(schema), tree)) as UnitTestTree;

    expect(tree.files).toEqual(jasmine.arrayContaining(['/libs/destination/test.txt']));
  });
});
```

## üî• Exception or Error

```bash
Failures:
1) applyTemplateFiles Rule should apply the files to the tree
  Message:
    TypeError: Cannot read property 'path' of undefined
  Stack:
        at <Jasmine>
        at ./apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/tools/file-system-engine-host-base.js:216:96
        at ./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/url.js:13:73
        at Object.callSource (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:55:20)
        at ./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/base.js:45:60
        at Object.callSource (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:55:20)
        at ./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/base.js:53:23
        at MergeMapSubscriber.project (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:74:24)
        at MergeMapSubscriber._tryNext (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/rxjs/internal/operators/mergeMap.js:69:27)
        at MergeMapSubscriber._next (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/rxjs/internal/operators/mergeMap.js:59:18)
        at MergeMapSubscriber.Subscriber.next (./tmp/apply-problem/node_modules/rxjs/internal/Subscriber.js:66:18)

2 specs, 1 failure
```

## üåç Your Environment

    "@angular-devkit/core": "^9.0.6",
    "@angular-devkit/schematics": "^9.0.6",
    "@types/jasmine": "^3.3.9",
    "@types/node": "^8.0.31",
    "jasmine": "^3.3.1",
    "typescript": "~3.5.3"

Commits
  • 6d19489 Mark release 7.1.1
  • 793c0e5 More rigorously check surrogate pairs in regexp validator
  • b5c1787 Fix incorrect comment in regexp parser
  • 12ae8fe Parameterize dummy value and export isDummy
  • fa3ad8c Further refine acorn-walk types
  • 1d50286 Fix some errors in walk types
  • 97801f0 Mark acorn-walk 7.1.1
  • e9372c1 Further clean up walker types
  • de6edeb Remove NarrowNode from walk.d.ts
  • 1d85e7c Fix: acorn-walk type work with acorn's
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Issues.Title: bug(material/table): style messy and buggy with Angular Mat-Table
Issues.Body:
Reproduction
I have create a github repo for this performance issue from angular material, here is the link https://github.com/jimkeecn/buildxactDemo

the problem in the repo is. I have created an angular element with a mat-input and mat-table. after building the angular element and used in other project. the mat-input is buggy, the placeholder will not move up while the input is focus and filled. Also the pagination of the mat-table is not working at the very start until i have trigger some detect change, however the pagination has slow reaction after click and werid styling and flicking of texts.

Steps to reproduce:

download the repo.
open the index.html in folder /I am outside of the project/
you will see the performance of the angular material input and table.
the component is actually in library project folder /search-page
angular element is in external project folder /app-component

Expected Behavior
I was expecting the mat-table pagination is working, and pagination button is clickable.

Actual Behavior
Mat-Table
pagination forward and backward button is not clickable
pagination dropdown is not clickable

Environment
Angular: ~9.0.3
Angular/elements: ^9.0.4
CDK/Material: ^9.1.0
Browser(s): Chrome
Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(material/table): style messy and buggy with Angular Mat-Table" (#18837)

Issues.Title: refactor(column-resize): simplify RTL handling
Issues.Body: The various column resize components had a ton of boilerplate just to apply an ltr/rtl class. We can avoid it altogether by using `[dir='rtl']` like we do in all of the other components.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(column-resize): simplify RTL handling" (#18835)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(datepicker): allow for the date range selection logic to be customized" (#18834)

Issues.Title: bug(Expansion Panel): Custom icon in header does not animate
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-3n3zkm

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click expansion panel header, icon will rotate, however the transition does not animate.

* There is a workaround.  If the transition is defined in css the animation works correctly.  To see this in the above stackblitz uncomment the animation-workaround class and remove the transition line from the component.
 
#### Expected Behavior
Icon should animate based on transition property.

#### Actual Behavior
Icon rotates, no animation occurs.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Expansion Panel): Custom icon in header does not animate" (#18833)

Issues.Title: fix(table): error when nesting tables
Issues.Body:
Previously we used to support nesting tables, but in v9 we had to make some changes in order to handle all cases in Ivy. As a result, nesting was broken due to parent tables picking up the cell definitions of their children. These changes add some logic to account for tables being nested.

Fixes #18768.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(table): error when nesting tables" (#18832)

Issues.Title: fix(bottom-sheet): allow result to be passed when dismissing through service
Issues.Body: A bottom sheet can be dismissed both through the bottom sheet ref and the service, but we only allow a result to be passed through the ref. These changes add a paramter to the service as well.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(bottom-sheet): allow result to be passed when dismissing through service" (#18831)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): add feature targeting to theme styles
Issues.Body: The MDC chips theme was including some styles without a feature target, resulting in some unnecessary styles being added.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): add feature targeting to theme styles" (#18830)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): handle custom preview/placeholder with multiple root nodes
Issues.Body: We support passing in a custom preview or placeholder using an `ng-template`, but we were only taking the first `rootNode` from the template.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): handle custom preview/placeholder with multiple root nodes" (#18829)

Issues.Title: refactor(cdk): use overloads to indicate deprecated constructor signatures
Issues.Body:
Historically we've been using `@deprecated` on constructor paramters to indicate when they're going to become required. This is incorrect, because it won't show up in tooling that looks for breaking changes.

These changes reworks all of the deprecated constructor signatures in the CDK to use overloads.

This PR is intended as a test run to see if there are any issues with the approach, before we can roll it out to Material which has a lot more constructor deprecations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(cdk): use overloads to indicate deprecated constructor signatures" (#18828)

Issues.Title: fix(dialog): recapture focus when clicking on backdrop when closing is disabled
Issues.Body:
`MatDialog` has an option to disable closing by clicking on the backdrop, but this can lead to focus being bumped back to the `body` and allowing users to tab past the dialog. These changes add some extra logic to recapture focus when the user clicks on the backdrop.

Fixes #18799.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(dialog): recapture focus when clicking on backdrop when closing is disabled" (#18826)

Issues.Title: help([MatSelect]): [Disable the control + A shortcut on mat-select multiple]
Issues.Body:
Hi,

I'm facing an issue on my current project. I'm using mat-select on an angular page, one of which has the `multiple` attribute. My issue is that users can select all checkboxes/options by using the shortcut Ctrl + A which I would like to disable as they shouldn't be able to do it.

I have tried everything I could think of including catching directly the KeyDown event to prevent it, but it appears that Material still reacts to it. Do you have any idea of how I could prevent that from happening ?

Thanks in advance

PS: sorry if this post is at the wrong place, it's actually my first GitHub post :d
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "help([MatSelect]): [Disable the control + A shortcut on mat-select multiple]" (#18809)

Issues.Title: perf(drag-drop): avoid unnecessary change detection on pointer down events
Issues.Body:
When the drag&drop was initially implemented it had to trigger change detection immediately once dragging started so that the data bindings get updated correctly. After some time we introduced a threshold for dragging that also triggers its own change detection and makes the initial change detection unnecessary.

Fixes #18726.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(drag-drop): avoid unnecessary change detection on pointer down events" (#18821)

Issues.Title: Suggestion: (cdk Collections): Documentation (any?)
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:

The cdk/Material table and especially the Material Paginator/Sort need dataSource classes to function correctly with complex data objects.    However, they currently have circular documentation that leads nowhere.   Material Table references the CDK table, which references the datasource, which, like all cdk Collections classes, is completely undocumented.


#### Is there anything else we should know?

I would suggest some official documentation around the Collections classes and DataSource objects in particular to understand what kind of inputs they are looking for and how they should be modified for complex objects to function with the sort/Paginator functions without extensive trial and error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Suggestion: (cdk Collections): Documentation (any?)" (#18818)

Issues.Title: bug([Mat Buttons: (not fabs]): Placing Mat Buttons inside a <a> with display: flex brings back link underline text
Issues.Body:
https://stackblitz.com/github/mikejunt/mat-button-example

Steps to reproduce:
1.   Place a button with any mat-button directive (button, raised, flat, stroked, icon) inside an anchor tag
2.  Style the anchor tag with display: flex (for example to use justify-content or align-content

#### Expected Behavior

In all other circumstances, link styling is removed from button text on material buttons that are links


#### Actual Behavior

Underlines.   Note that this behavior is NOT present if you use display: -webkit-box.  

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.5
- CDK/Material: 9.1.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10 Pro
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug([Mat Buttons: (not fabs]): Placing Mat Buttons inside a <a> with display: flex brings back link underline text" (#18813)

Issues.Title: fix(input/testing): unable to set the value of inputs that don't respond to typing
Issues.Body:
The `setValue` method of the input harness is set up so that it types out the value in the input. This won't work for inputs that don't respond to typing (e.g. `color`). These changes add an extra call that also sets the `value` property of the input, on top of typing into it.

Fixes #18790.

Note: not sure whether the change to the `TestElement` signature needs to be made optional first.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(input/testing): unable to set the value of inputs that don't respond to typing" (#18812)
